channel.title: Projects on Development Data Partnership
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Development Data Partnership

item.title: Building Urban Resilience by Mapping Formal/Informal Transit for Freetown, Sierra Leone.
item.description: The team is receiving pro-bono data collection and processing and support from Where Is My Transport, for creating the first complete map of the Freetown transit system.

item.title: Closing the Data Gap in Bicycle Planning and Evaluation Efforts: Toolkit for Mexico City.
item.description: The team has received dockless bikeshare trip data from Mobike, which they are integrating with multiple data sources to improve planning cycling and pedestrian infrastructure.

item.title: Data Fusion for Outbreak Prediction
item.description: The team is using the Google Health Trends API, combined with data from Twitter and news APIs (Data Collaboratives covers the Google partnership) to improve prediction of outbreaks in fragile states.

item.title: Identifying Crash Hotspots in Nairobi
item.description: The team is using the Waze API to analyse user-reported crash data in Nairobi and comparing these data to official records as part of a road safety investment program.

item.title: Informing Emissions Mitigation and Livlihoods Enhancement Work in Fiji with Remote Sensing
item.description: The team is using Digital Globe data on Fiji from 2006 to 2016 to assess land use change and forestation levels.
